titleStmt.title: A speech made by the right honourable the Earl of Arran, to the Scotch nobility and gentry, met together at the council chamber in White-Hall, on the eighth of January 1688, about an address to His Highness the Prince of Orange, to take upon him the government of the kingdom of Scotland.
titleStmt.author: Hamilton, James Douglas, Duke of, 1658-1712.
Arran, Richard Butler, Earl of, d. 1686.

notesStmt.note: The Earl of Arran = James Douglas, Duke of Hamilton, who was style Earl of Arran until 1698.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
